posts.subject: Welcome to /sweet/
posts.body:
This is a board to post, discuss and share /sweet/ little girls. Insta, model sets, candids or others.
==Rules:==
'''1.''' Use common sense.
'''2.''' Don't be unnecessarily rude to one another.
'''3.''' If you hate pedos and can't stand this board, then why are you here? Go away!
'''4.''' Ignore all of the above, this is a place of freedom.

Nudity and lewdness are allowed.
Childporn and on topic media in general are also allowed here, as long as they contribute in any way to the discussion or otherwise serve a purpose.
The same goes for hurtcore and other more extreme things, just don't be a jerk and spoiler them.
While childporn is allowed, this should not be your go-to childporn place. 
If you are looking for that, be it something specific(requests), the desire to fap or maybe to unload your mighty folders to the benefit of all, please go to [>>>/CP/](/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/?:1CheeseGbTxP5Hij7EDjipWZ7UDJZTaPey:0) instead.

Have a nice day!

>>3ee44bb9-e39c-4a87-9034-95bc42eceaa8
A new board. What beauty; What mystery; What future will await us, in this here unmanned land, I wonder?

>>2e344e86-cec3-4ddb-98f2-ce09331fad01
Truly, a great fate lies before us.

>>e8d77a0a-53e5-4cd5-a55e-4b52c39cea11
Shotas do nothing for me, so I don't think I should be in control over something I neither care for, nor am involved with at all.
>**Shotafags can just create their own hub if they want .**
**Exactly. Should someone want to make one and needs help, I'm happy to help.**

>>aad02705-7345-49f3-82e9-c250f3209474
>>d94a6dc9-4d74-4bfc-b67f-fca7717dbf5f
Doesn't load for me either.
Also, welcome to both of you!
How are you? Did you have a nice day?

>>124c1ff0-a477-4be6-8a03-d474fed44b65
>Not great but I had worse.
At least that.
>How about you? How have you been?
Well yesterday I was pretty good, today not so much. I had a go at adding an anonymous posting feature to pedohub. As it turns out zeronet has a lot more of restrictions on auth addresses than I thought. The `fileWrite` command in particular has been really frustrating for me. Anonymous posts don't look too great right now...

>>5d84c6de-30c9-4397-9545-86cf09c41a07
>>e098fdb9-a2c3-4625-be49-e2d5db433a7f
>>06ddad11-1de5-4d8d-aef3-edf92f203291
> is there a filesize/filetype restriction on this board?
Well not on this board, but I think millchan itself has a custom limit of 10MB **can't where where mcdev said that though**.

>>94159810-1aa2-47ef-a8b7-3b0f92e70dbd
I remember there being some talk about this. I wonder what their actual instructions looked like for this scene.
>this is the movie's only worthwile scene, which is just some adult-romance snorefest.
Overall, would you say the movie is worth watching?

>The mom comes to help her daughter(?), casually wearing a python.
Sure why not.

>>9df3051e-789c-483b-9103-abdb5652105d
>She is cute
I second that.
>As in everyone posting from the same ID?
No as in every post is a new ID **unless the user wants to reuse one of his previous IDs**.
>since there is no access to the master seed
<rant>
Not only that(don't get me wrong this is good), but `fileWrite` only actually writes the file, if your auth_address matches the last dir in your local path, anyone in the zites signers list or the zite address itself. But there is no way(that I am aware of) to change the auth_address for any zite. Even when adding new certificates, since zeronet will just assume that they were always signed for the current zites auth_address regardless of whether or not the signature on that certificate is actually valid or not, which is really misleading. All that means that, unless you delete your users.json file, '''all''' anonymous posting features are broken(millchan, 0chan, ZeroVoat and others).
</rant>
>I think the only limit is the 5MB limit on required files (data.json).
>By default, there are no restrictions on optional files.
True, but I thought millchan would refuse to upload files bigger than 10MB in javascript, but skimming through millchan source code this doesn't appear to be the case. I also can't find where he said that anymore, so maybe it just wasn't millchan.

>>a81d8140-37b2-4274-af1f-925709195adf
Spreading the word, I guess.
Unfortunately having to install something is a pretty high barrier of entry for most people **and rightfully so, unfortunately**. I mean many don't even bother with Tor. So I think all we can do is spreading the word, improve what's here already and hopefully reach critical mass at some point.

>>c35a5ffd-5829-4c02-828c-71175a9f5c75
It is pretty quiet right now, but peer numbers **at least mine** are more or less the same, as before, so I guess we just have a lot of lurkers on ZeroNet right now. Not sure why that is though, probably because of the distinct lack of content and/or because there isn't much to talk about.
ZeroNet has the issue that a lot of content requires many people to propagate fast, without peers the amount of content is somewhat limited and without content peers will lose interest. And this is in addition to the I already have X, why should I go to Y. This specific issue could be solved with an freenet-ish contribution of disk space for data of random ZeroNet zites in encrypted form.

>>401444db-cbda-41c9-baa0-aa4a71c1f36b
Shame, do you happen to know any ''good'' movies?

>>9dfe3e31-7827-426e-8278-3518cda937d9
>I remember some cucks virtue signalling claiming to be extremely disgusted! with that scene.
Who can blame them? Closets do get pretty comfy after some time.

How to style your posts(remove the `|`-char):
|>|>1
>>a8a43fbf-50a8-416b-9535-3a7cf71ff16a

|>greentext
>greentext

~|~strike~|~
~~strike~~

'|'|'bold'|'|'
'''bold'''

'|'italic'|'
''italic''

*|*spoiler*|*
**spoiler**

_|_underline_|_
__underline__

=|=RED TEXT=|=
==RED TEXT==

[A link to /sweet/]|(/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/?:1Sweetyby4djYXnkVZGzTzyZ5gCWQ7ooN:0)
[A link to /sweet/](/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/?:1Sweetyby4djYXnkVZGzTzyZ5gCWQ7ooN:0)

|-Item1
|-Item2
|-Item3
- Item1
- Item2
- Item3

Single line code(code snippets) are done exactly as in markdown.
`Single line code`
**It's a single char, which means I can't put it here without actually making a code snippet.**

[|code]
Multi-
line-
code
or
text
[|/code]
[code]
Multi
line
code
or
text
[/code]

>>abfd976c-3083-4262-91a6-493cffe477af
>Well proxies can be used as an alternative
They could, but this is really risky. ZeroNet as it currently is does not work without js, so you're forced to enable on the proxy. That proxy can see what you're doing and inject js into the webpage, that your browser will execute without you knowledge.
Try accessing millchan /LG/ or /CP/ with [0net.io](https://0net.io)(Clearnet) to see what I mean.
>Speaking of alternatives there is a P2P browser called Beaker.
I never really looked into Beaker/Dat, but from the looks of it Dat does nothing in terms of anonymity, which is a downer. Have you tried it? If so how was it?
>I never felt like that was a good way to measure things around here.
It really isn't. But if you don't have any files pending, then it is good for a rough estimate, if observed over a long time.
>I'd assume it be down since, apparently, Chinese people are, once again, having problems accessing the network.
I'd also assume that, but (as a Tor only node) I still get around 200 nodes from china.
>the fact that Freenet stores random data in the user's computer is exactly what keeps some people away from it
Maybe turning that off by default would still improve things, but even then, as you said, you'd have to not necessarily rewrite, but change a lot in the protocol to make it work.
I absolutely agree with you.

>>7fc93959-aaf8-48d8-8dba-5e4f89e48c13
Good work!
I currently don't have an spare flash drive where I could test it on, but I'll be sure to try that as soon as possible.

A few question I have on this:
Does ZeroNet actually work with these instructions? According to the thread in millchan [>>>/zeronet/](/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA//?:users/1DJEfWgdJ3rGnqCrKwLrBdQGodRaEBkAry:zeronet:0) the default control port of 9051 is not open on tails.
>{local ip}
By that do you mean `127.0.0.1`(`localhost`)?
If not why does it need to be the ip on the private lan?
>fileserver_ip = {local ip}
As far as I know this is not necessary, since with `tor always` zeronet will replace it with an onion.

>>5828be69-9aff-4dbe-9a89-4ff8e1556318
>I will to see if I can limit the yml whitelisted commands even farther without breaking Zeronet (GETINFO to just version, exe-paths to just zn, hosts maybe)
Would be a good idea. As far as I understand the yml file, every running process can now access the control port.
After a bit of searching I found [this](https://git-tails.immerda.ch/onion-grater/commit/?id=33ae20850329930bd1a3686cca2a9ac4dc766aea)(Clearnet) commit, which I think is really helpful. It explains the yml config anatomy of the onion-grater(what does what) in good detail.

>>630fa5b0-bfd5-4381-82d7-10b35fcba274
>The control port is always open by default on Tails.
Figured that, but `sudo ./Zeronet.sh --debug --tor_controller 127.0.0.1:9052 --tor always` from the other thread seemed to imply that tails had it's control port on `9052`. Well if it works for you, then that's probably just a weird alteration that anon made, I guess.

>>8b4d207b-4dae-457e-a6ed-da0a947e4e9d
>the control port is on 9052 and always open but not accessible to any program except onion-grater which makes it available on 9051 to other programs
Oh, okay that makes sense.

>>34e81077-ee80-468b-bd81-abd434e99135
>Let's hear it for the girls who know how to ride
ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽˆ

**Also: Why did you censor the hose?**

>>fc8f0b56-349b-47dc-b752-a7666f88206b
>You made my day a little bit brighter
Thank you!

>because she saw a cool slime video
Have you ever tried making [Oobleck](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-Newtonian_fluid#Oobleck)(Clearnet) with her? It's basically just mixing corn starch and water in a roughly 2 to 1 ratio. I was babysitting my nephew some time ago and we decided to do that, had a pretty good time with it. **Kind of makes a mess, though.**

How did you to came to be together? How is it like actually having a lgf to pour your love into? 
**I'm kind of a virgin in that regard, so I wouldn't know ;_;**
Have any stories you're willing to share?

>>90b56355-ff14-44d2-83b4-71d2651a92fe
>So what I did was I asked her out by making a bunch of slimes, placing them out on the dining room table where I tutor her
That's pretty cheesy, but also neat, I guess.
>>12fa4875-14bd-4d47-aefd-0af3ded31cf2
>Unless we're talking about a 15yo+ granny
Actually I've also been wondering that. How old is/was she? If you feel comfortable sharing her age, that is.
>>32abe547-c65e-4216-8fda-a3e0cf888c9e
He has a point, at least where I live this is incredibly risky, but there are places where it's considerably less risky(excusable).
I didn't believe that you could just walk up to some random kids and talk to them without raising redflags all over the place, when I heard that at fist, too. Turns out things are different in some parts of the world.
>>402bf984-9c0b-412f-8a78-2442a8e6b9ff
Neat.

>caramel apple
I actually have a burning hatred for these things. Whenever I get one it's made of like at least 20% caramel crust (by weight!), which is super hard to actually eat/bite through. I have never not hurt myself while eating one and despite that I still get one every other year or so, because 'surely this one is different, I've just been unlucky all this time', but it never is, it's always disappointment and frustration with these things.
I ''really'' dislike caramel apples.

>>33d162bd-fa6c-4c1d-8263-53235217e7c5
>cosy/10
>seems kinda shy to me
>rather on the tail end of my aoa
7.5/10 - Would tenderly cuddle.

**To fix your image errors, go into `[YourZeroNetDataDir]/1Sweetyby4djYXnkVZGzTzyZ5gCWQ7ooN/data/users/1EkqQLvNsvKCWcYvWGX449SLvXwJsZdVXa` and in `data.json` replace occurrence of `\"directory\":\"users/` with `\"directory\"`. Save your changes and then in millchan engine edit your post without actually modifying your post(`arrow`->`Edit post`->`EDIT`).**

>>925530dd-c320-46cd-a7c4-11f7898295eb
Wow, I did not expect to feel so strongly about this story.
>>33c18154-0f52-4324-bb00-cf82a31f6bf4
>This story is definitely one of my all time favorites.
It absolutely is up there now.
>There's something about Alex being unable to hide anything from Alyssa that really gets to me.
That hit me way harder then I ever thought it would.

Personally, I spent most of my life lying to people in an effort to hide who and what I am.
Having spend ludicrous amounts of time and effort to build a net of plausible deniability 'just in case', the thought of actually having to come clear in explicit detail with someone in person, without any fail safes, guarantees or outs for me, is downright terrifying. Especially if that someone else is within your AoA and can literally read your every thought, every backdoor you might have set yourself up for the future, every bad thought you had in a time when you were in a bad place and everything you are now actively trying to hide from her.
The introduction part of Alex to Alyssa was (for me at least) absolutely intense. With so much on the line for both of them, the implications that surfaced as the situation progressed and the tensity of that whole scene really hit me hard.

Great story! Thanks for sharing, definitely worth reading!

**Also: I want a sweet psychic lgf, that just wants to be tightly hugged ;_;**

>>f21aff6a-9bc4-4593-8dd4-5516d35e137d
Good to have you back!
>The problem with Tor darknet is that all those lovingly crafted indexes disappear when the sites inevitably go down.
Have you a downloaded copy of them? Assuming they are just html stuff, mirroring them here on zeronet would take no time at all.
>>6cb73360-6b9e-402a-b45c-ea9aa2cd1932
You can do multi line code with
[|code][/|code]
**(remove the | symbol)**
See >>200fcbc9-8968-4cec-a757-2f782cc9cf28 for a more complete list.

Do you want the resulting json file to be compatible with the zeronet sqlite database importing mechanism? In that case the json has to be fairly shallow(your idea girls->name->sets->ImgName->size wouldn't work). If you want this mechanism to be able to collect it into an database,  you can have at most two 'layers' of object, so something like this:
[code]
{
	"CandyDolls":{
		"AbroraH":{
			"Image":[PathToImageHere],
			"Image_size":100,
			[age, sets and so on]
		},
		[moar girls]
	},
	[moar studios]
}
[/code]
would work.

posts.subject: /sweet/ - Dev and coding thread
posts.body:
In this thread you can ask for help/support/contributors on your own projects, offer your time as coder/designer or make suggestions/requests for things you'd like to see on ZeroNet to the devs in this thread.
You can also showcase your zites here and/or ask for feedback.
